New Records: India recorded their highest second-highest World Cup score
Shreyas Iyer reached his fourth ODI hundred
Virat Kohli fell short of his 50th ODI century
Key Match Events: Virat Kohli took an ODI wicket after nine years
Mohammed Siraj struck early in the second innings
Ravindra Jadeja's introduction brought Rohit Sharma success
Shubman Gill fell next ball trying to find another six
Pre-Game Insights: India captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and chose to bat and said they go in unchanged
Netherlands skipper Scott Edwards says he would have batted too and adds they too are fielding the same XI as the one that played against England
Post-Match Reflections: Congratulations to India fans and commiserations to the Dutch faithful
India finished the league stage off on a 9-0 note in Bengaluru
Netherlands, though, will be delighted getting near 250
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch is really good and Shami-Siraj have been conceding
India with a near-perfect day with the bat
Bengaluru is always a tough place for bowlers
India's batters are in pristine form
Others: India's 410/4 is their highest second-highest World Cup score
Shreyas Iyer reaches his fourth ODI hundred
Virat Kohli falls short of his 50th ODI century
